conclusion: Analyze the motion of the charged particle in the electric and magnetic fields using given conditions and equations.

Two vertical baffles P and M with spacing l, upper edges at the same horizontal level, uniform electric field directed vertically downwards with strength E, uniform magnetic field perpendicular to paper and outward.
Particle with mass m and charge q launched horizontally to the right with velocity v0 from a point in the electric field, enters magnetic field at P and exits between lower edges Q and N.
Particle's motion influenced by electric and magnetic fields; initially experiences force F = qE in electric field causing vertical acceleration, horizontal velocity remains constant.
Upon entering magnetic field, particle experiences force F = qvB causing circular motion.
Angle between particle's velocity direction and PQ is 60°, use radius equation r = v / ω.
Velocity component v_x = v * cos(60°) = v/2.
Time taken for particle to travel from P to Q is t = l / v_x = 2l / v.
Angular velocity ω = v / r = v / (v/2) = 2.
Since vertical displacement equals spacing between baffles, launch position is at point P.
Distance from particle's launch position to point P is l.
